translation.en: [Connie] I, Constance Reid, take you, Clifford Chatterley,
translation.it: Io, Constance Reid, prendo te, Clifford Chatterley,

translation.en: to be my lawfully wedded husband,
to have and to hold from this day forward,
translation.it: per amarti e onorarti da oggi in avanti.

translation.en: for better and for worse,
for richer and for poorer,
in sickness and in health.
-[Connie laughing] -[Hilda] How does it feel? -I don't know. Ask me tomorrow. -[Hilda laughs]
translation.it: - Come ci si sente? - Non lo so. Chiedimelo domani.

translation.en: -[Hilda] You need to eat something. -I need to get out of this dress.
How do I look?
Well, I doubt Clifford will want to stay long at the reception.
translation.it: Beh, dubito che Clifford vorrà attardarsi al ricevimento.

translation.en: You don't think his mother would've approved?
translation.it: Pensi che la madre avrebbe approvato?

translation.en: Well, I'm not entirely sure I do.
translation.it: Non ne sono del tutto certa.

translation.en: Are we talking about the dress now, Hilda, -or the wedding? -[lips smacking]
translation.it: Stiamo parlando dell'abito, Hilda, o del matrimonio?

translation.en: He goes back to the front in the morning. Imagine if we'd left it,
translation.it: Partirà per il fronte domattina. E se avessimo rimandato e fosse accaduto qualcosa di orribile?

translation.en: and then something terrible happened.
translation.it: E se avessimo rimandato e fosse accaduto qualcosa di orribile?

translation.en: -Couldn't you have just had sex with him? -Hilda! Be serious.
translation.it: - Non potevi farci solo sesso? - Hilda! Sii seria.

translation.en: I am. It's much less commitment, and it's all Clifford will want anyway.
translation.it: Lo sono. Sarebbe stato meno impegnativo e comunque è ciò che vuole Clifford.

translation.en: Clifford's not like that.
You know him. He's kind and thoughtful. He makes me feel safe.
translation.it: Lo conosci. È gentile e premuroso. Mi fa sentire protetta.

translation.en: His family's more traditional than ours, I suppose,
translation.it: La sua famiglia è più tradizionalista della nostra,

translation.en: but I think his own views are actually quite progressive.
translation.it: ma le sue idee sono piuttosto progressiste.

translation.en: -[Hilda] Really? -Yes.
-Does he know about that German boy? -Yes. And he says it doesn't matter.
translation.it: - Sa di quel ragazzo tedesco? - Sì. E dice che non gli importa.

translation.en: It was before the war, so it doesn't count.
translation.it: Risale a prima della guerra. Non conta.

translation.en: [Hilda] You don't need to convince me. I had my own German boy, remember?
translation.it: Non devi convincere me. Anch'io ho avuto un ragazzo tedesco.

translation.en: Well, mine's dead.
-[sighs] -You see, that's just it.
-What? -[sighs]
I don't want to see you get hurt again.
translation.it: Non voglio che tu soffra ancora.

translation.en: You, uh… You open your
heart so easily.
Oh, Hilda!
-Clifford! -Hmm, reinforcements have arrived.
You read my mind.
[chuckles] I nearly drank yours on the way up.
translation.it: Ho quasi bevuto il tuo, salendo.

translation.en: -[Clifford] Cheers. -Cheers.
Well, what now? [Clifford] Our fathers are preparing their toasts.
translation.it: - E ora? - I nostri padri preparano i brindisi.

translation.en: Can we face them together?
[Clifford] Of course.
You look stunning, Con.
Thanks.
[Clifford] Are you ready?
-So, here's to Clifford and Connie… -[tapping on glass]
…our new hope for an heir to Wragby. [laughs]
translation.it: in cui riponiamo le speranze per un erede a Wragby.

translation.en: [all] To Clifford and Connie.
Father, that's not just why we married.
translation.it: Non ci siamo sposati per questo.

translation.en: No, why else would a baronet get married?
translation.it: Quale altro motivo può avere un baronetto?

translation.en: -I married because I found Connie. -And I you.
translation.it: - L'ho fatto perché ho conosciuto Connie. - E io te.

translation.en: We would like to thank those who donated their butter and sugar rations
translation.it: Ringraziamo chi ci ha donato le razioni di burro e zucchero

translation.en: to help us celebrate.
To the next heir of Chatterley.
-[guests] To the Chatterleys! -[glasses clinking]
Oh God. "Why else is a baronet ever married?"
translation.it: Oddio. "Quale altro motivo può avere un baronetto?"

translation.en: Unbelievable. [scoffs]
Do you want children, Clifford?
Uh, yeah. Yeah, someday.
-For our sake, not for my father's. -Hmm.
translation.it: Per noi, non per mio padre.

translation.en: Assuming you would.
I think so, yes.
What? You all right?
Yes, um, of course. Sorry. Uh…
It's just, um…
I can't stop thinking about going back to the front.
translation.it: So che dovrò tornare al fronte.

translation.en: -I… I know I'll be all right. -You will be.
translation.it: - Ma non mi accadrà nulla. - Certo.

translation.en: -We don't have to do anything. -No, no, I… I want to.
translation.it: - Non siamo costretti. - No, voglio farlo.

translation.en: Sure you don't want me to come to the station? [Clifford] Thanks.
translation.it: - Sicuro che non mi vuoi alla stazione? - Grazie.

translation.en: Let's not make a ceremony of it, shall we?
I love you, Con.
Bye.
I look forward to your letters.
translation.it: Attenderò con ansia le tue lettere.

translation.en: I'll write to you every day.
[Connie] Dearest Hilda, I knew the war would change us all,
translation.it: Cara Hilda, sapevo che la guerra ci avrebbe cambiati,

translation.en: but I just wasn't sure how much.
It feels as though it ended half a lifetime ago, not just half a year.
translation.it: È come se fosse finita mezza vita fa e non mezzo anno.

translation.en: We've already moved away from London.
We've just arrived at Wragby,
Clifford's family estate.
Once we're settled in, I expect to write to you often.
translation.it: Una volta sistemati, ti scriverò spesso.

translation.en: Your loving sister, Connie.
[Connie] Thank you.
[Mrs. Warren] Welcome home, Sir Clifford. We've been praying for you.
translation.it: Bentornato, Sir Clifford. Abbiamo pregato per lei.

translation.en: Thank you, Mr. Warren.
There's the one
[Connie] All right.
Thank you. I can, uh… I can manage.
Mr. and Mrs. Warren, this is my wife,
translation.it: Signore e signora Warren, lei è mia moglie,

translation.en: the new Lady Chatterley. It's so nice to meet you, milady.
translation.it: - la nuova Lady Chatterley. - Piacere, milady.

translation.en: There's plenty of work to be done.
Hire back all the workers we can, Mrs. Warren.
translation.it: Riassumiamo quanti più ex dipendenti possibile.

translation.en: Old girl's seen better days. [Connie chuckles] We'll bring her back to life.
translation.it: - La tenuta ha visto tempi migliori. - La riporteremo in vita.

translation.en: We thought you might like to use your father's study as the master bedroom,
translation.it: Potrebbe usare lo studio di suo padre come camera padronale,

translation.en: so you don't have to bother with the stairs.
[chuckles] Thank you, Mrs. Warren.
No, let's put the luggage in here.
We'll use the library as a master.
What is more inspiring for a writer than to sleep among books?
translation.it: Dormire tra i libri sarà stimolante per uno scrittore.

translation.en: This is where they found Father. They say his heart gave out.
translation.it: Qui hanno trovato mio padre. Gli ha ceduto il cuore.

translation.en: I think he died of chagrin.
Clifford… it's all done now.
translation.it: Clifford, è tutto alle nostre spalle.

translation.en: Life is what we make of it. [chuckles]
translation.it: Siamo gli artefici del nostro destino.

translation.en: -Mrs. Warren. -Yes.
Let's open the curtains, let some light in. [Mrs. Warren] Of course, milady.
translation.it: - Apriamo e facciamo entrare la luce. - Certo, milady.

translation.en: -[Clifford] We should have a look around. -I will.
You're welcome to use the private room above the library
translation.it: Puoi usare la stanza coi ritratti di famiglia

translation.en: with the family portraits. You can have the whole of the second floor.
translation.it: sopra la biblioteca. Il secondo piano sarà tutto tuo.

translation.en: Welcome home, Clifford.
You all right? I've got you. Lean on me, put your weight on me.
translation.it: Ci sei? Ti aiuto. Appoggiati, ti reggo io.

translation.en: -[Clifford grunts] Ready? -Mm-hmm. Yes. [exclaims]
I'm getting the hang of it. [sighs]
-Love it. -Mmm.
[Clifford sighs] You know, um…
I'm thinking of expanding the short story I wrote in Cambridge.
translation.it: Stavo pensando di sviluppare il racconto scritto a Cambridge

translation.en: -Hmm? -Turning it into a novel.
-It's a wonderful idea. -You think?
-You'll be my editor? -Of course.
Proofreader, typist. I'll submit my application.
translation.it: Correttrice di bozze e dattilografa. Mi assumi?

translation.en: I'll get you to the top of the pile.
-All right? -Yes.
-Ooh, this bed is softer than I thought. -[both chuckle]
-First night at Wragby. Hmm. -Welcome.
translation.it: - La prima notte a Wragby. - Benvenuta.

translation.en: -Oh, sorry. -Oh, you're fine. Really.
What?
I'm sorry, Con.
I just can't anymore, you know?
I'm so sorry.
It's all right. Don't worry.
You'll be fine?
Yes.
[whispering] I love you, Con.
This is misfortune, but you'll see.
We… We'll be happy here
at Wragby.
Hello, sir.
I'm a strong, hardworking man, and I will not let you down.
translation.it: Sono forte e un gran lavoratore. Non la deluderò.

translation.en: Lily Wheedon. My mum worked for Sir Geoffrey.
translation.it: Lily Wheedon. Mia madre lavorava per Sir Geoffrey.

translation.en: Really?
You, uh, worked for my father before the war.
translation.it: Prima della guerra, lavorava per mio padre.

translation.en: Aye, sir.
-And you were an army lieutenant. -I was, sir.
translation.it: - Ed è stato tenente. - Sì, signore.

translation.en: Do you honestly believe that a return to gamekeeping
translation.it: E crede che tornare a fare il guardacaccia

translation.en: will be satisfying after your time as an officer?
translation.it: la soddisferà dopo essere stato un soldato?

translation.en: Bit of quiet'd do me good.
-I've seen enough of what war does to men. -[Clifford] Hmm.
translation.it: Ho visto cosa fa la guerra agli uomini.

translation.en: As have I.
You must know your way around the estate better than I do.
translation.it: Conoscerai la tenuta meglio di me.

translation.en: [Lily] Oh, no, milady. I couldn't visit while she was working.
translation.it: No, milady. Non potevo venire qui quando lavorava.

translation.en: Very well then. Welcome back, Mr. Mellors.
translation.it: Molto bene, allora. Bentornato, sig. Mellors.

translation.en: [Oliver] Sir.
[Connie] In that case, we'll have to learn our way around together. Won't we?
translation.it: In tal caso, dovremo ambientarci entrambe.

translation.en: -[Lily] Hmm. -Thank you, Lily.
My name is Kelly Martin, milady.
-Thank you. -I've been a maid for five years.
translation.it: - Grazie. - Sono stata a servizio per cinque anni.

translation.en: [Connie] Dear Hilda,
I'm a thoughtless lout for not writing sooner.
translation.it: scusa se non ti ho scritto prima.

translation.en: In my defense, Wragby needed an enormous amount of tending to.
translation.it: In mia difesa, Wragby aveva bisogno di essere risistemata,

translation.en: But we finally have a full staff who've done wonders in restoring the place.
translation.it: ma ora abbiamo dei domestici che hanno fatto meraviglie.

translation.en: Clifford's strength has returned.
I'm still the only one he's willing to let help him,
translation.it: Continua a volersi far aiutare solo da me,

translation.en: but every day, he can do more and more on his own.
translation.it: ma sta diventando sempre più indipendente.

translation.en: He's writing, all the time,
which keeps his spirits up, and he's nearly finished his first novel.
translation.it: e questo lo tiene di buon umore. Ha quasi finito il primo romanzo.

translation.en: [Clifford] "I first met Mrs. Gertrude at a dinner, comma,
translation.it: "Conobbi la sig.ra Gertrude a una cena, virgola,

translation.en: -thrown by Lord Witherby." -[typewriter clacking]
"With the sort of fellow, whom--" I'm quite pleased with this…
translation.it: "Con il genere di persona…" Di questa frase vado fiero.

translation.en: -"The sort of fellow…" -[Connie] It is quiet here in the country.
translation.it: C'è molta pace qui in campagna.

translation.en: I miss the life we had in London,
translation.it: Mi manca la nostra vita a Londra

translation.en: and, of course, I miss you.
But we have to live, I suppose,
no matter how many skies have fallen.
translation.it: non importa quanti cieli ci siano crollati addosso.

translation.en: [Connie] We have had some guests.
Mostly Clifford's old bachelor friends.
It's hardly surprising that most of them haven't found women, believe me.
translation.it: Non mi sorprende che siano rimasti tali, credimi.

translation.en: Now and again, we also get visits from writers whose advice Clifford has sought out.
translation.it: Vengono a trovarci scrittori a cui Clifford chiede consiglio.

translation.en: Apparently, my old friends all seem to think misfortune is contagious.
translation.it: Forse i miei vecchi amici ritengono le sciagure contagiose.

translation.en: I know you and Owen have been traveling everywhere since the war ended,
translation.it: So che tu e Owen avete viaggiato molto dalla fine della guerra,

translation.en: but once you've settled back home, I would so love to see you.
translation.it: ma una volta risistemati a casa vorrei tanto vederti.

translation.en: -Am I interrupting? -[Clifford] No, not at all.
I was thinking about going to London for a few days
translation.it: Pensavo di andare a Londra qualche giorno

translation.en: to visit Hilda.
Leaving me to fend for myself?
[chuckles] We do have a house full of servants.
translation.it: La casa è piena di domestici.

translation.en: I don't need servants. I need you.
Why don't you invite Hilda? She'd be more than welcome.
translation.it: Perché non inviti Hilda qui? Ne sarei felice.

translation.en: I have. She can't get away from London for a few weeks.
translation.it: L'ho fatto. Non può allontanarsi da Londra per alcune settimane.

translation.en: Hmm. I'm glad at least she can come.
I'm going to go for a walk.
[Clifford] Why? We can send Mrs. Warren out for anything you might need.
translation.it: Perché? Possiamo affidare le commissioni alla sig.ra Warren.

translation.en: I don't need anything, Clifford. I just want to go for a walk.
translation.it: Non mi serve niente, Clifford. Voglio solo fare due passi.

translation.en: Very well, dear.
-As you like. -Jesus.
-[whistling nearby] -Hello. [Oliver] Flossie! Come here, lass.
[Oliver] Come on.
Good girl. Good girl.
I wandered further down and I found this stream running right through the woods.
translation.it: Sono scesa un po' di più e ho trovato un ruscello in mezzo al bosco.

translation.en: [grunts] I, uh, think I know the place. Doubt I'd be able to get there anymore.
translation.it: Penso di aver capito dove. Ma non credo che ora ci arriverei.

translation.en: I'm sure we can find a way if you wanted to go.
translation.it: Troveremo il modo, se vuoi andarci.

translation.en: -Right. -Perhaps.
Here we are.
-Ready? -Yes.
All right.
[groans] It's fine.
-It's all right? -Yes.
Uh, I don't want you to drop me.
I'm not going to drop you.
Look, just, um…
There we go.
There we are. That's fine. Just let me go there.
Thank you. Thank you.
[grunts] Ah. There. -See, you didn't need my help at all. -[panting, chuckles]
translation.it: - Ecco. - Visto? Hai fatto tutto da solo.

translation.en: -There must be times you hate me for this. -No.
translation.it: - A volte mi odierai per questo. - No.

translation.en: I wouldn't blame you.
There are days I wish I hadn't made it back.
translation.it: A volte, rimpiango di essere tornato.

translation.en: Don't talk like that.
I'd be lost without you, Con. You know that.
translation.it: Sarei perso senza di te, lo sai.

translation.en: Let's open some windows, get some fresh air in here.
translation.it: Apriamo e facciamo entrare un po' d'aria fresca.

translation.en: I've never seen the sky so clear.
Yes, well, there's no smoke in the air. Mines are closed for May Day.
translation.it: Non c'è fumo. Le miniere sono chiuse per il Calendimaggio.

translation.en: You should go down to Tevershall.
See the fair. You can, you know?
Just be back in time for tea.
-Yes, I might. -Hmm.
-[man] Nice to see you, Lady Chatterley. -[woman] Milady.
It's nice to meet you, Lady Chatterley.
Oh, that's so kind.
Thank you.
Happy May Day to you, milady. Happy May Day.
Who's this? She's precious.
translation.it: E lei chi è? È adorabile.

translation.en: -This is my Josephine. -Hi, Josephine.
Say hello to Lady Chatterley.
I seem to be having that effect on people today.
translation.it: Oggi pare che abbia questo effetto sulla gente.

translation.en: I'm Mrs. Flint. I'm a schoolteacher here in the village.
translation.it: Sono la sig.ra Flint. Sono un'insegnante qui al villaggio.

translation.en: I'm Connie. Lovely to meet you.
My, uh… My husband leases Marehay Farm from your estate.
translation.it: Mio marito ha in affitto la vostra fattoria di Marehay.

translation.en: -Marehay Farm? -It's not far from where you are.
[chanting] Side by side we fight forever. More in numbers makes them stop.
translation.it: Fianco a fianco, lotteremo. L'unione fa la forza e li fermeremo.

translation.en: Just as long as we stand together.
What was that?
[Mrs. Flint] The miners. They're out protesting again.
-Again? -[woman 1] Leave him!
Um, that, um… That happens a lot?
They must've been from one of the other mines.
They'd lose their jobs if they marched like that through their own village.
translation.it: Vengono licenziati se protestano nel proprio villaggio.

translation.en: Does it mean our miners from Tevershall protest in other villages?
translation.it: Quindi i minatori di Tevershall protestano in altri villaggi?

translation.en: I wouldn't know.
I may teach their children,
but I'm an outsider when it comes to the miners' wives.
translation.it: ma per le mogli dei minatori sono un'estranea.

translation.en: That makes two of us.
-[woman 2] Well, hello, Lady Chatterley. -Hello.
[Mrs. Flint] You should come to Marehay one day.
-We'd love to have you. -I'd love that.
Thank you.
Where are we going?
You've always wanted me to join you on one of your walks.
translation.it: Volevi che ti accompagnassi in uno dei tuoi giri.

translation.en: I thought of somewhere I'd like to show you.
-Don't think your chair was made for this. -[chuckles]
translation.it: Non credo che la sedia ce la farà.

translation.en: Ah, Mellors. Give us a hand trying to get this chair started again.
translation.it: Mellors. Può darci una mano a far ripartire la sedia?

translation.en: Yes, sir.
Uh, Connie, have you met Mellors, our new gamekeeper?
translation.it: Connie, conosci Mellors, il nuovo guardacaccia?

translation.en: Get down, you, Floss.
She's just being friendly. [chuckles]
Now, then.
You've been at Wragby sometime, Mr. Mellors?
translation.it: Vive a Wragby da tempo, sig. Mellors?

translation.en: I was raised here, Your Ladyship.
[Connie] Need some help?
[grunts] Mellors is quite capable of pushing on his own. There we are.
translation.it: Mellors può spingermi da solo. Ecco fatto.

translation.en: -Now… Now, now. -[grunts]
Nothing else, sir?
Nothing else. Good day.
[Connie] That was kind of you. Hope it wasn't too heavy.
translation.it: È stato gentile. Spero non fosse troppo pesante.

translation.en: No, not heavy.
Good day to you, Your Ladyship.
[Clifford] I used to come here as a lad, sit for hours. One of the finest views in all the Midlands.
translation.it: Da ragazzo sedevo qui per ore. Uno dei panorami più belli delle Midlands.

translation.en: I want to restore these woods. If these places aren't preserved, there'll be no England left.
translation.it: Voglio ripristinare questi boschi. O non resterà nulla dell'Inghilterra.

translation.en: Our way of life will end, never mind what we gave up to defend it.
translation.it: Questo stile di vita cesserà pur avendo dato tanto per difenderlo.

translation.en: I mind not being able to have a son here more than any other place.
translation.it: Questo posto rende più doloroso non poter avere figli.

translation.en: I'm sorry we can't have one.
Almost be a good thing if you had a son by another man.
translation.it: Mi augurerei quasi che l'avessi da un altro uomo.

translation.en: You're not serious?
-Why not? -Why not? Because…
Because we're married.
I married you, Clifford.
Why would you even suggest such a thing?
You've told me how much you'd love a child.
This way, you could have one to dote on, to fill your days.
translation.it: Avresti qualcuno da amare e che ti riempie le giornate.

translation.en: As far as anyone else knows, I might still be capable of fathering a child.
translation.it: Per quanto si sa, potrei essere io il padre.

translation.en: If we raised him here at Wragby, he'd be ours.
translation.it: Se lo crescessimo a Wragby, sarebbe nostro.

translation.en: Do you really mean this?
Well, of course, I wouldn't want you to yield yourself completely to him,
translation.it: Beh, certo, non vorrei che ti abbandonassi totalmente a lui,

translation.en: but the mechanical act of sex is nothing when compared to a life lived together.
translation.it: ma l'atto meccanico del sesso non è paragonabile a una vita insieme.

translation.en: If you govern your emotions accordingly,
we could arrange this like a trip to the dentist.
translation.it: sarebbe come una visita dal dentista.

translation.en: A trip to the… [scoffs]
And you wouldn't mind what man's child I had?
I trust your judgment. You wouldn't let the wrong sort of fellow touch you.
translation.it: Mi fido del tuo giudizio. Non ti faresti toccare dal tipo sbagliato.

translation.en: Someone of the utmost discretion. The Chatterley name depends on it.
translation.it: Un uomo discreto. Ne va del nome dei Chatterley.

translation.en: Would you expect me to tell you who this man was?
translation.it: E dovrei dirti chi è quest'uomo?

translation.en: Best I don't know.
An heir really means this much to you?
translation.it: Per te un erede significa tanto?

translation.en: It means a lot to the people here.
I know you can do it for them and for the Chatterleys.
translation.it: So che potresti farlo per loro e per i Chatterley.

translation.en: You do agree with me, don't you?
I'm going ahead.
Okay.
They're all talking about your book in London. It's good work.
translation.it: Parlano tutti del tuo libro, a Londra. È un bel romanzo.

translation.en: You really think so? I wanted to write something special.
translation.it: Lo credi davvero? Volevo scrivere qualcosa di speciale.

translation.en: Not just popular, but something really first class.
translation.it: Un romanzo popolare, ma anche di grande qualità.

translation.en: The entire pals collective across the entire northeast,
keeping them together, making sure they've got all of--
So sorry. Will you excuse me? Just for a second?
translation.it: Chiedo scusa, torno subito. Le spiace?

translation.en: Uh, yes. Um…
You imagine they've solved the world's problems yet?
translation.it: Avranno risolto i problemi del mondo?

translation.en: [chuckles] I'm sure they think they have.
Shame they've forgotten their solutions by daybreak.
translation.it: Peccato che all'alba dimentichino le soluzioni.

translation.en: You're a writer. Maybe you should take notes.
I doubt I'd be welcome in that drinking circle.
translation.it: Non sarei ben accolto nel loro circolo.

translation.en: Don't worry. I'm not really a part of this world, either.
translation.it: Tranquillo. Anch'io sono estranea a questo mondo.

translation.en: -Oh, but you grew up in it, didn't you? -Hardly. My father's an artist.
translation.it: - Ma ci sei cresciuta, no? - A malapena. Mio padre è un artista.

translation.en: So I grew up between rented villas
translation.it: Sono cresciuta tra ville in affitto

translation.en: and woke up each morning to the smell of turpentine.
translation.it: e l'odore di trementina al mattino.

translation.en: Sounds like quite the Bohemian lifestyle.
There must be days when you don't feel like a lady at all.
translation.it: Devono esserci giorni in cui non ti senti una vera dama.

translation.en: I head back home in the morning. With luck, he'd invite me to visit again.
translation.it: Tornerò a casa domattina. Se avrò fortuna, mi inviterà di nuovo.

translation.en: That's the last time we'll invite the Irish playwright.
translation.it: Non inviteremo più il drammaturgo irlandese.

translation.en: -Michaelis? -Hmm.
He writes well, he knows how to dress,
but he's got the manners of a Dublin street rat.
translation.it: ma ha i modi di un furfante dublinese.

translation.en: Maybe because he knows he's only around as long as people deem him useful.

[whispers] You are beautiful.
You know, I don't think I… realized how lonely I've been until now.
translation.it: Sai, finora non mi ero resa conto di quanto fossi sola.

translation.en: Thank you.
You better go.
Ten of spades. Well, I have got you there with the king.
translation.it: Dieci di picche. Ma non può niente contro il mio re.

translation.en: -[Connie] I, Connie… -[Oliver] I, Oliver…
-…take you, Oliver… -…take you, Connie…
-…in strength… -[Connie] …and in freedom…
[both] …and in ecstasy.
-[exclaims] -[Oliver] How deep is it?
-[Flossie whines] -Please.
-"Why do I like you?" -Mm-hmm.
"Fruit is black."
Oh, Your Ladyship, I'm sorry to disturb you.
-I saw the light and-- -[chuckling] It's all right, honestly.
translation.it: - Ho visto la luce e… - Va tutto bene.

translation.en: [sighs] Sit. Be happy to have some company.
translation.it: Si sieda. Mi fa piacere un po' di compagnia.

translation.en: Really.
Why are you up so late?
Uh, Sir Clifford, he's not been sleeping. [sighs]
translation.it: Sir Clifford non riesce a dormire.

translation.en: I can't help looking in on him.
-Hmm. -It was the same with me husband.
translation.it: Era lo stesso con mio marito.

translation.en: If he so much as got a cold, I'd be up all night worrying over him.
translation.it: Se prendeva il raffreddore, lo vegliavo tutta la notte.

translation.en: [Connie] Ted.
You must miss him. Oh, it's been 25 years,
translation.it: - Deve mancarle molto. - Sono passati 25 anni

translation.en: but do you know, still sometimes in bed,
I'll wake up, and I think, "He's not in bed with me."
translation.it: mi capita di svegliarmi e pensare: "Non è accanto a me".

translation.en: [Connie] Oh, it's just the touch of him.
Aye.
It's amazing, isn't it?
How someone can get so into your blood.
translation.it: Come qualcuno può entrarti nel sangue.

translation.en: [Mrs. Bolton] Oh, it is.
It can make you bitter.
If it hadn't been for that pit, Ted'd still be here.
translation.it: Se non fosse per quella miniera, Ted sarebbe ancora qui.

translation.en: He hated it down there.
He hated it, but what could he do? He was trapped.
translation.it: Lo odiava, ma cosa poteva farci? Era in trappola.

translation.en: I suppose we all are in different ways.
translation.it: Per certi versi, lo siamo tutti.

translation.en: You never wanted to remarry? -Oh, Lord. -[both chuckle]
translation.it: - Non ha mai voluto risposarsi? - Oh, cielo!

translation.en: Ted was the only one? He was.
But you and your man, you know, you grow together.
translation.it: Ma lei potrà invecchiare con suo marito.

translation.en: Who else is there in life? Children, of course, but… Oh.
translation.it: Cos'altro può esserci nella vita? I figli, certo, ma…

translation.en: -I'm sorry, that was thoughtless of me. -No.
translation.it: - Mi scusi. Non ci ho pensato. - No.

translation.en: Don't worry. It's fine.
More than fine, actually.
There still might be some hope in that regard.
-For you and Sir Clifford? -Hmm.
Doctor says his recovery is remarkable.
translation.it: Il dottore dice che fa progressi.

translation.en: So who knows? I might have a child yet.
translation.it: Chi può dirlo? Potrei avere un figlio.

translation.en: Well, I hope and pray that you do.
translation.it: Beh, spero e prego che avvenga.

translation.en: Can I get you a blanket?
No, I'm fine, thank you.
Sleep well. Save some secrets for our next conversation.
translation.it: Riserviamo qualche segreto per la prossima volta.

translation.en: Good night.
[inhales deeply] Come on now, you lass.
I think we're best off outside.
translation.it: Il meglio è fuori di qui.

translation.en: Come on.
-[groaning] -[Mrs. Bolton] There, there.
Has Her Ladyship not risen yet?
translation.it: Sua signoria non si è ancora alzata?

translation.en: -She got up before I did. -Hmm.
translation.it: Si è alzata prima di me.

translation.en: She's already had her breakfast, then.
Yes. She's out on one of her walks.
translation.it: Sì. È andata a fare uno dei suoi giri.

translation.en: I was up early myself.
There were a lot of people out this morn. [breathing heavily]
-The gamekeeper, he was-- -Could you get me some fresh cream?
translation.it: - Il guardacaccia… - Della panna fresca, grazie.

translation.en: -Yes, sir. -Thank you.
-[water splashing] -[woman 1] Since Sir Clifford took over, they've been working the poor miners to the bone.
translation.it: Dall'arrivo di Sir Clifford, i poveri minatori lavorano come schiavi.

translation.en: I thought the machines were supposed to make the work easier.
translation.it: Credevo che i macchinari agevolassero il lavoro.

translation.en: It's a way to make more money with fewer workers.
translation.it: Aumentano i guadagni con meno lavoratori.

translation.en: [woman 2] Don't he have enough money already?
Oh, bet his lady needs her baubles and silk so she can lord her station over the rest of us.
translation.it: Alla moglie serviranno gingilli e seta per guardarci dall'alto in basso.

translation.en: No, she's not like that.
She treats folks who work with her with the same respect she'd treat a lord or lady.
translation.it: Tratta i domestici con lo stesso rispetto che riserva ai ricchi.

translation.en: My Lily says the same about her.
translation.it: Lo dice anche la mia Lily.

translation.en: Well, she deserves better then.
Such a hard lot that's fallen to her.
translation.it: Le è capitato un bel fardello.

translation.en: Oh! As it happens, uh, Sir Clifford may not be quite as done in as we thought.
translation.it: A quanto pare, Sir Clifford potrebbe non essere poi un peso così morto.

translation.en: Oh, his legs won't work again, but, you know, rest might.
translation.it: Le gambe non torneranno a funzionargli, ma il resto potrebbe.

translation.en: Her Ladyship has even suggested there might be a child one day soon.
translation.it: Sua signoria ha anche suggerito che potrebbero avere un figlio.

translation.en: What? -No! -[chuckling]
-That's amazing. -You ever heard of such a thing?
translation.it: - Magnifico. - Avete mai udito una cosa simile?

translation.en: [Clifford] How long should these things last?
[Mr. Linley] If we keep them in good repair, for generations.
translation.it: Con una buona manutenzione, per generazioni.

translation.en: Speaking of which, sir, if you don't mind my asking,
translation.it: A proposito di generazioni, se non sono troppo audace,

translation.en: is there any truth to the rumor
translation.it: posso chiedere se è vera la voce

translation.en: that we may still have hope of an heir at Wragby?
translation.it: secondo cui a Wragby potremmo avere un erede?

translation.en: Are there rumors?
Yes.
Everyone's been asking me what I know about it.
I am happy to set the record straight if the rumor's unfounded.
translation.it: Sarò felice di smentire, se la voce è infondata.

translation.en: Indeed.
Well…
there may yet be hope.
Hello, Con.
I've just had the most interesting meeting with Mr. Linley.
translation.it: Ho appena avuto un incontro interessante col sig. Linley.

translation.en: Have you heard the rumor
that you are to supply Wragby with an heir?
translation.it: secondo cui darai un erede a Wragby?

translation.en: Is it a joke?
I'd hoped it might be a prophecy.
I received a letter from Father.
He's been invited to Venice for July and August
translation.it: È stato invitato a Venezia in luglio e agosto

translation.en: and has asked me and Hilda to come with him.
translation.it: e ha chiesto a me e Hilda di andare con lui.

translation.en: July and August?
I wouldn't need to go for that long.
translation.it: Non devo fermarmi così a lungo.

translation.en: Three weeks should be more than enough time for what we discussed.
translation.it: Tre settimane dovrebbero bastare per il nostro progetto.

translation.en: Have plans already been set in motion?
translation.it: Hai già messo in moto qualcosa?

translation.en: Not just yet.
If I were absolutely certain you'd want to come back to me?
translation.it: E mi prometti di tornare da me?

translation.en: Of course I would.
I don't want to know his name.
translation.it: Non voglio sapere il suo nome.

translation.en: No one can.
Well, in that case, I think it ought to be all right, don't you?
translation.it: In tal caso, penso che andrebbe bene. Tu no?

translation.en: [Connie] You know how much you mean to me, don't you?
translation.it: Sai quanto tengo a te. Vero?

translation.en: And you to me.
I have to go away for a while.
-Where? -Venice.
With Sir Clifford?
-For how long? -Just a couple of months.
translation.it: - Per quanto? - Un paio di mesi.

translation.en: But no, not with Clifford.
He doesn't like to travel how he is.
Aye. The poor devil.
-You won't forget about me. -Forget?
-Mm-hmm. -You know nobody forgets.
It's not a question of memory.
Look, um…
I told Clifford I might have a child.
translation.it: Ho detto a Clifford che potrei avere un figlio.

translation.en: You did?
I… I think I'm already… expecting.
translation.it: Penso di essere già… in dolce attesa.

translation.en: What did he say?
He said he'd be glad
as long as the child seemed to be his.
translation.it: purché tutti credano che il figlio è suo.

translation.en: So where does Sir Clifford suppose that this child is coming from?
translation.it: E secondo Sir Clifford da dove arriva il bambino?

translation.en: -I said I might have an affair in Venice. -You might. So that's why you're going.
translation.it: - Da una possibile avventura a Venezia. - È per questo che vai.

translation.en: Not to have the affair. Just the appearance of one.
translation.it: Non per averla. Per fingere di averla avuta.

translation.en: So that's why you wanted me then.
translation.it: Per questo ne hai avuta una con me?

translation.en: To get a child.
Of course not, Oliver.
I never planned on you. I never planned on any of this, really.
translation.it: Non avevo previsto di stare con te, né tutto questo.

translation.en: What was the plan then, Connie?
translation.it: E qual era il tuo piano, Connie?

translation.en: What was the plan, really?
-What was the plan? -I--
-I don't know. -You don't know?
translation.it: - Non lo so. - Non lo sai?

translation.en: Well, then, I am damned if I do.
translation.it: Allora che sia dannato se lo so io.

translation.en: Fucking hell.
Well, it's as Your Ladyship likes.
translation.it: Sarà come piace a sua signoria.

translation.en: If you get a child, Sir Clifford's welcome to it.
translation.it: Se avrai un figlio, se lo terrà Sir Clifford

translation.en: I shan't have lost anything. On the contrary, I've had a nice experience.
translation.it: e io non avrò perso nulla. Anzi, sarà stata una bella esperienza.

translation.en: -Don't talk like that. -If you've made use of me,
translation.it: - Non dire così. - Forse mi hai usato,

translation.en: it's not the first time I've been made use of, is it?
translation.it: ma per me non è stata la prima volta.

translation.en: I don't suppose it's ever been as pleasant as this time.
translation.it: Non sarà stato piacevole come questa volta,

translation.en: Of course, one can't feel tremendously dignified about it.
translation.it: ma chiaramente non è cosa di cui andar fieri.

translation.en: I didn't make use of you… Oliver.
As Your Ladyship pleases.
-You forgot your book. -[door slams]
Or have you made use of that as well?
translation.it: O hai finito di usare anche quello?

translation.en: With the new generators, we'll be able to reduce the workforce.
translation.it: Con i nuovi generatori, diminuiremo la forza lavoro.

translation.en: -Striking will be impossible. -What about the workers?
translation.it: - Niente più scioperi. - E i lavoratori?

translation.en: No man's forced to work for me. I'm not forced to hire them.
translation.it: Non sono obbligati a lavorare per me.

translation.en: -No wonder the men hate you. -They don't hate me.
translation.it: - Ora so perché ti odiano. - Non mi odiano.

translation.en: They depend on me. They should be grateful. They'd starve without someone to tend them.
translation.it: Dipendono da me. Dovrebbero ringraziarmi. Morirebbero, se non avessi cura di loro.

translation.en: You talk about them as if they're herd animals.
translation.it: Ne parli come se fosse un gregge.

translation.en: Not all of them.
An individual may rise from the pack now and again.
translation.it: Un individuo può spiccare ogni tanto.

translation.en: Most of those men have been ruled since time began.
translation.it: Molti sono sotto padrone da sempre.

translation.en: And you can rule them?
Yes, because I've been brought up and trained to do so.
translation.it: Sì, perché sono stato formato per farlo.

translation.en: That's my role in society, as it's their place to serve.
translation.it: È il mio ruolo sociale. Il loro è servire.

translation.en: So there is no shared humanity between us?
translation.it: Non c'è niente che ci accomuna in quanto esseri umani?

translation.en: We all need to eat and breathe, but beyond that, no.
translation.it: Solo il fatto di mangiare e di respirare.

translation.en: Shall we go as far as the spring?
Good day to you, Mr. Mellors!
-[horn honking] -Ayuh.
Wait, Clifford. I'll push. What's the use of the thing if she needs to be pushed?
translation.it: - Ti spingo io, Clifford. - A che serve quest'affare, se va spinto?

translation.en: -[grunts] You're making it worse! -Be quiet a moment, will you?
translation.it: - Così peggiori le cose. - Taci un secondo.

translation.en: Damn thing!
-[grunts] -Wait, stop!
-[horn honks] -Mellors.
-Yes, Sir Clifford? -Know anything about blasted motors?
translation.it: - Sì, Sir Clifford? - Se ne intende di maledetti motori?

translation.en: -I'm afraid not. Has she gone wrong? -Apparently!
translation.it: - Temo di no. Si è inceppata? - È evidente!

translation.en: Just have a look and see that nothing's broken.
translation.it: Controlli che non ci sia niente di rotto.

translation.en: No.
Seems all right as far as I can see, sir.
translation.it: Da quel che vedo, sembra a posto.

translation.en: [Clifford] Then stand back.
-Maybe if I give it a push. -No. She'll do it herself.
Yeah?
-You see? Good. -[engine straining]
Are you pushing? I asked you not.
-It won't go if I don't. -Give it a chance, man!
translation.it: - O lo faccio o si ferma. - Le dia una chance!

translation.en: Clifford, watch your brake.
-Right. Fine. -Clifford!
It's obvious I'm at everybody's bloody mercy.
translation.it: Sono alla mercé di tutti, è ovvio.

translation.en: It would seem, Mr. Mellors, that she would need to be pushed.
translation.it: A quanto pare, devo essere spinto, sig. Mellors.

translation.en: Do you mind? -Not at all, sir. -Hmm.
Right.
-Hang on, hang on. -[grunts]
-Two, three. -[engine starts]
Bombs away.
-[Oliver grunts] -There we are.
For God's sake, man, what's the matter with you?
Lungs are a bit knackered, sir. [coughs] Little souvenir from the war.
translation.it: Ho i polmoni un po' fuori uso. Un regalino della guerra.

translation.en: [Clifford] What the hell are you doing?
-He needs my help, Clifford! -[Clifford] God's sake.
You all right?
[Clifford] I suppose the other chair will need a new set of wheels.
translation.it: Dovremo cambiare le ruote all'altra carrozzella.

translation.en: [Connie] Who do you think you are?
I mean, how can you treat someone like that?
translation.it: Come puoi trattare una persona così?

translation.en: [Clifford scoffs] Who? The gamekeeper? He was injured in the war as well.
translation.it: - Chi? Il guardacaccia? - Anche lui è stato ferito in guerra.

translation.en: I mean, if he was in that chair, what would you have done to him?
translation.it: Se ci fosse lui su quella sedia, cos'avresti fatto?

translation.en: I find your comparison in very bad taste.
translation.it: Trovo il tuo paragone di cattivo gusto.

translation.en: I find your lack of common sympathy to be in the worst taste imaginable.
translation.it: E io trovo la tua mancanza di empatia di pessimo gusto.

translation.en: You and your ruling class.
translation.it: Tu e la tua classe dirigente.

translation.en: I thought you were different, but you're not.
translation.it: Ti credevo diverso, ma non lo sei.

translation.en: You make people work for £2 a week or starve.
translation.it: Fai lavorare la gente a due sterline a settimana o meno.

translation.en: It's not ruling, Clifford.
That's bullying.
Come on in, then.
I'm sorry.
I'm sorry for hurting you.
I don't want you for the sake of a child… Oliver.
translation.it: Non ti ho voluto per avere un figlio, Oliver.

translation.en: I just want you.
All right?
All right.
But Clifford has to believe that I tried to keep us together.
translation.it: Ma Clifford deve credere che ho lottato per restare con lui

translation.en: That this was his idea,
just all gone terribly wrong.
For him to give me a divorce, for us to be together,
translation.it: Perché mi conceda il divorzio, per stare con te,

translation.en: he needs to believe that.
I just want to be with you.
If that's what you want.
It's not about wanting, Connie. You know what I want.
translation.it: Non c'entra ciò che voglio, Connie. Sai cosa voglio.

translation.en: I've still got to get a divorce from Bertha meself.
translation.it: Anch'io devo ancora ottenere il divorzio da Bertha.

translation.en: What happened with Bertha?
I went off to war, she carried on with other men.
translation.it: Sono andato in guerra e lei mi ha tradito.

translation.en: And now she refuses to divorce me.
translation.it: Ma non mi concede il divorzio.

translation.en: -What about her other man? -Ned?
translation.it: - E l'uomo con cui sta? - Ned?

translation.en: -Mm-hmm. -He's a big baby of a fella.
She bullies him.
They both drink, he gets sent around here to harass me for me war pension.
translation.it: Bevono entrambi e lei lo manda a estorcermi la pensione di guerra.

translation.en: Aye, let's dinna fight.
[Oliver] I'm sorry.
Why don't we just leave them all behind?
Go to Australia.
Go somewhere…
Anywhere.
-The three of us? -Just our family.
No one would judge us.
Seems a wrong and bitter thing to be bringing a child into this world.
translation.it: Sembra sbagliato e penoso far nascere un figlio oggigiorno.

translation.en: -You don't mean that. -I do.
-No. -No, I mean this world here.
I'm pleased for us.
I'm pleased for you to be pleased.
translation.it: E sono contento che tu sia contenta.

translation.en: But when I think about around here, what man has done to man…
translation.it: Ma se penso a questi luoghi, a ciò che l'uomo ha fatto all'uomo,

translation.en: …what leaders of men have done to their so-called fellow men.
translation.it: i governanti ai loro cosiddetti fratelli…

translation.en: Reduced them to less than humanness.
translation.it: Li hanno privati della loro umanità.

translation.en: Half corpses and they think about nowt but money.
translation.it: Quasi morti, pensano solo al denaro.

translation.en: Living to make money.
But not all of us have the freedom to live life how we want.
translation.it: Ma non tutti hanno la libertà di vivere come vorrebbero.

translation.en: Not all of us can do as we--
What are you doing?
[Connie] Come on!
Where is she? She's been gone for hours.
translation.it: Dov'è finita? È via da ore.

translation.en: Well, I'm sure it's just the rain that's keeping her.
translation.it: Sarà rimasta bloccata per via della pioggia.

translation.en: She's… she's probably sheltering in the hut.
-I'll send Warren and Betts to find her. -No, don't you do that.
translation.it: - Manderò Warren e Betts a cercarla. - Non lo faccia.

translation.en: It'll only get people talking.
I'll slip over to the hut and, uh, see if she's there.
translation.it: Andrò io al capanno per vedere se è lì.

translation.en: -What? And leave me here alone? -Oh, don't you worry.
translation.it: - E mi lascia qui da solo? - Non si preoccupi.

translation.en: We'll be back in no time.
-Ayup. -Ayup.
-Ayup, me duck. -Ayup, me duck.
I leave for Venice on Thursday.
I'll come by the cottage that night.
[Mrs. Bolton] Milady?
Oh, milady, there you are.
Sir Clifford asked me to look for you. He was worried something had happened.
translation.it: Sir Clifford mi ha mandata a cercarla. Temeva le fosse successo qualcosa.

translation.en: No. No, I was sheltering in the hut from the rain.
translation.it: No. Mi sono riparata dalla pioggia nel capanno.

translation.en: Mrs. Bolton.
Your Ladyship would be quite all right from here.
translation.it: Sua signoria è al sicuro, ora.

translation.en: Good evening to you. Good evening to you, Your Ladyship.
translation.it: Buona serata. Buona serata a lei, sua signoria.

translation.en: I am not a child. It's monstrous that I have to be followed.
translation.it: Non sono una bambina. È assurdo che debba essere seguita.

translation.en: My Ladyship, don't say that.
Sir Clifford was sure you'd been struck by lightning.
translation.it: Sir Clifford temeva che l'avesse colpita un fulmine.

translation.en: It's not your fault. It's foolish of Clifford to worry.
translation.it: Non è colpa sua. Lo sciocco è lui.

translation.en: Well, let's go home now.
And I'll take care of the rest.
You don't need to send the servants out after me. [Clifford] God, where have you been?
translation.it: - Non devi mandare i domestici a cercarmi. - Dov'eri finita?

translation.en: You've been gone out hours, and in a storm like this.
translation.it: Sei stata via per ore e durante un temporale.

translation.en: What have you been doing?
translation.it: - Cos'hai fatto? - E se non te lo dicessi?

translation.en: What if I choose not to tell you? I went to the hut and lit a fire.
translation.it: - Cos'hai fatto? - E se non te lo dicessi? Ero nel capanno.

translation.en: -Look at you. The state of your hair. -I went out into the rain… naked.
translation.it: - Guardati. Guarda che capelli. - Sono stata nuda sotto la pioggia.

translation.en: [sputtering] Are you mad?
Suppose Mellors had seen you while you were prancing with nothing on.
translation.it: E se Mellors ti avesse vista senza vestiti?

translation.en: Yes… suppose he had.
You're right, Clifford. I should really go and get cleaned up.
translation.it: Hai ragione, Clifford. Devo darmi una sistemata.

translation.en: [Clifford] Connie!
[Connie] My sister's here!
-[Hilda] It's so good to see you. -It's been too long.
[Hilda] Good to see you.
[Connie] You know I've met someone, don't you?
translation.it: Sai che ho conosciuto qualcuno, vero?

translation.en: I gathered from your letters, yes.
I tried to tell myself it was nothing. I tried to stay away. I did.
translation.it: Ho provato a convincermi che non era niente, a evitarlo.

translation.en: But I can't. He…
translation.it: Ma non ce l'ho fatta. Lui…

translation.en: I really love him.
-Wow. -And-- I know.
And I said I would stay with him tonight. I promised.
translation.it: Gli ho promesso di stare con lui stanotte.

translation.en: Are you going to tell me who he is?
He's our gamekeeper.
[hesitates] No, Hilda. He's lovely.
Honestly, he has such an understanding and tenderness.
He's quite the exception, you'll see.
I long hoped you would find someone else.
-But one of Clifford's servants? -I'm not giving him up!
translation.it: - Ma un domestico di Clifford? - Non rinuncerò a lui!

translation.en: [scoffs] Listen to you. It's you and that German boy all over again.
translation.it: Ma sentitela. Mi sembra di rivederti con quel tedesco.

translation.en: -It's not, Hilda! It's nothing like that! -Yes, it is!
translation.it: - No! Non è la stessa cosa! - Invece sì!

translation.en: Confusing sex with love, and then thinking it can continue
translation.it: Confondi sesso e amore e pensi possa continuare così solo perché lo vuoi tu.

translation.en: just because it's what you want.
translation.it: e pensi possa continuare così solo perché lo vuoi tu.

translation.en: Please, come to Venice and take the time to think through what you really want.
translation.it: Ti prego, vieni a Venezia e rifletti su ciò che vuoi davvero.

translation.en: I know what I want!
-Really? -Yes!
And I'm seeing him tonight or I'm not going to Venice. I can't!
translation.it: E lo vedrò stasera o non verrò a Venezia! Non potrei!

translation.en: I really thought that you, of all people, would understand!
translation.it: Pensavo che proprio tu, fra tutti, avresti capito!

translation.en: Goodbye.
-Bye. -I look forward to your letters.
You have a good time, and then come back and cheer us up.
translation.it: Si diverta. Aspetteremo il suo ritorno.

translation.en: I will. Take care.
This is my sister, Hilda.
-[Oliver] Hello. -Hilda, this is Oliver Mellors.
translation.it: - Salve. - Hilda, lui è Oliver Mellors.

translation.en: -Hello. -Pleasure to meet you.
Take a seat then.
[Connie] Hilda.
What do you want me to say?
Whatever it is you're thinking.
Very well.
It is one thing to hold trysts in your cottage,
translation.it: Passi avere una tresca in un cottage,

translation.en: but what happens when you go out into the world?
translation.it: ma che succederà quando uscirete fuori?

translation.en: When Connie's friends cross the street to avoid her.
translation.it: Quando gli amici di Connie la eviteranno?

translation.en: That's not fair.
She's got me figured out, then, eh?
What summed me up so quick? Were it summat I said?
translation.it: Come ha fatto? È per qualcosa che ho detto?

translation.en: Mr. Mellors.
How do you expect to take care of her once you've lost your job?
translation.it: Come si occuperà di lei quando avrà perso il lavoro?

translation.en: Do you actually believe you can give her a chance at happiness?
translation.it: Crede davvero di poterla rendere felice?

translation.en: Oh, you're asking the wrong person there.
All I know is I get a great deal of happiness from her.
translation.it: Io so solo che lei mi rende felice.

translation.en: -Thought of your own happiness at least. -Hilda, enough!
translation.it: - Ha pensato alla sua felicità. - Ora basta!

translation.en: I think you understand far better than she does
translation.it: Credo che capisca meglio di Connie

translation.en: how badly this could end, Mr. Mellors.
translation.it: che questa storia può finire male.

translation.en: Think about how much she really means to you.
translation.it: Pensi a quanto tiene a lei.

translation.en: I'll pick you up in the morning, Connie. Early.
Don't keep me waiting.
-Mr. Mellors. -[Connie] Hilda.
I'm so sorry. I shouldn't have brought her.
translation.it: Mi dispiace tanto. Non dovevo portarla qui.

translation.en: Please don't let her upset you.
She's just protective.
She's right.
We haven't thought beyond tomorrow, have we?
translation.it: Non abbiamo pensato al futuro, vero?

translation.en: Sir Clifford will fight this divorce. He'll fight to keep our child.
translation.it: Sir Clifford si opporrà al divorzio. Lotterà per tenere nostro figlio.

translation.en: I never had to think about these things until you turned up.
translation.it: Non dovevo pensare a queste cose prima di conoscerti.

translation.en: Let's go upstairs.
Yeah, that's good. That's good.
-[gasping, moaning] -Yes.
The fuck are you playing at, Ned?
Calm down, Mellors. I'm not here to fight. Bertha sent me.
translation.it: Calma, Mellors. Non voglio fare a botte. Mi manda Bertha.

translation.en: She's your problem now.
Not mine. Ain't how she sees it.
translation.it: - Non mio. - Lei non la vede così.

translation.en: She's still your wife, entitled to half your military pension.
translation.it: È ancora tua moglie. Le spetta mezza pensione di guerra.

translation.en: Aye, and I'm entitled to a divorce. I won't get one, will I?
translation.it: E a me spetta il divorzio ma non lo avrò, giusto?

translation.en: -Fuck off, then. -[Flossie growling]
-All right. I'm going. -[Flossie barks]
[Ned] I'm going.
[Connie] Is he gone?
Unless his heart's just given out running.
translation.it: Se il cavallo non è corso via da solo…

translation.en: Stay there till we know he's gone.
translation.it: Resta lì finché non ne siamo certi.

translation.en: -[car horn honks] -Oh, what is she thinking?
Go on.
[Hilda] Connie.
For heaven's sake, Connie.
We're going to Venice tomorrow. Do you have to look so miserable?
translation.it: Domani partiamo per Venezia. Devi avere quell'aria così triste?

translation.en: I think I'm pregnant.
Right.
I assume it's not Clifford's.
Although, he did say he would be happy for me to have a child with another man.
translation.it: Sebbene abbia detto che sarebbe felice se avessi un figlio da un altro uomo.

translation.en: -Seriously? -Mm-hmm.
I don't know how much longer I can do this. It's all right.
translation.it: - Non so quanto possa continuare così. - Tranquilla.

translation.en: What exactly?
What's happened?
I'm in love with someone
other than Clifford.
So you've taken a lover?
Well, good.
Do I know the man?
[scoffs] No.
But I think I… want a divorce from Clifford.
translation.it: Ma penso di voler chiedere a Clifford il divorzio.

translation.en: [Sir Malcolm] Because of your feelings for this other man?
Well, if you want my opinion… [sighs]
translation.it: Beh, se vuoi la mia opinione,

translation.en: I'm sorry, but you stand to gain very little by breaking things off.
translation.it: otterresti ben poco lasciando tuo marito.

translation.en: Feelings come and go.
You may love one man this year and another the next,
translation.it: Ami un uomo quest'anno e un altro il prossimo,

translation.en: but the world will go on.
And Wragby will go on standing.
Please yourself,
but stick by Wragby.
And Wragby will stick by you.
Let's go to Venice, shall we?
[Ned] He comes back home thinking he's better than the lot of us.
translation.it: Tornato dalla guerra, si crede migliore di noi.

translation.en: Gets the world to think poor Bertha's to blame for all their trouble,
translation.it: Sparge la voce che la povera Bertha è la causa dei loro guai

translation.en: and then he refuses to support her.
-[man] Bloody disgrace. -I know.
Bertha goes to the cottage today, trying to patch things up.
translation.it: Bertha oggi è andata al cottage per sistemare le cose.

translation.en: Makes sense. She found them silk nightclothes in the fire.
translation.it: - Certo. - C'era una camicia da notte nel camino.

translation.en: No wonder he keeps to himself. He's hiding a woman in there.
translation.it: Per questo sta sulle sue. Nasconde una donna.

translation.en: Lady Chatterley loans her gamekeeper a book, and she's accused of… Sorry, that's outrageous.
translation.it: Lady Chatterley ha dato un libro a Mellors e ora la accusano… Scusate, è oltraggioso.

translation.en: [woman] Of course it is. I won't breathe another word on the subject.
translation.it: Certo. Non dirò un'altra parola sulla questione.

translation.en: [woman 2] Everyone's talking about it. You know how people gossip.
Sir, no one wants to have this conversation,
but we must.
[Linley] And of course, it's pure nonsense.
translation.it: Sono certo che non è vero,

translation.en: But your gamekeeper seems to inspire all manner of rumors.
translation.it: ma il vostro guardacaccia ha scatenato dicerie.

translation.en: The sooner you pack him off, the better.
translation.it: Deve mandarlo via al più presto.

translation.en: [Clifford] I appreciate you coming to me with this. Your concerns are noted.
translation.it: Grazie di avermelo riferito, Linley. Ne terrò conto.

translation.en: Hello… [hesitates]
I'd like a London number, please.
translation.it: Mi serve un numero di Londra.

translation.en: -Ayuh, Mrs. Bolton. -Good day.
I hear Sir Clifford's asking for me.
translation.it: Sir Clifford ha chiesto di me.

translation.en: Of course, yes. He's in his study.
Right, aye.
Mr. Mellors.
I called Her Ladyship, and she's coming back.
translation.it: Ho chiamato sua signoria e rientrerà.

translation.en: -When? -This evening.
As soon as she can get here.
She said you could meet at the hut and decide what to do.
translation.it: La aspetterà al capanno per decidere il da farsi.

translation.en: There's…
There's dark days coming, Mrs. Bolton.
translation.it: Ci aspettano giorni bui, sig.ra Bolton.

translation.en: Best to steer clear from it all.
[Clifford] Come in.
You are my servant,
living upon my land at my sole discretion,
translation.it: che vive sulle mie terre per mia scelta

translation.en: and now your indecencies have become the subject of gossip.
translation.it: e ora le tue indecenze sono sulla bocca di tutti.

translation.en: You should shut the mouths of the gossips--
Are you aware that Lady Chatterley's name has been slandered?
translation.it: Il nome di Lady Chatterley è stato infangato.

translation.en: Apparently, her name was inscribed in a book found at the cottage.
translation.it: Pare fosse scritto su un libro trovato nel cottage.

translation.en: I've got a picture of Queen Mary on me wall calendar.
translation.it: Ho la regina Mary sul calendario.

translation.en: I suppose she's in my harem as well.
translation.it: Anche lei è nel mio harem?

translation.en: I do not appreciate your sarcasm, Mellors.
translation.it: Non apprezzo il tuo sarcasmo, Mellors.

translation.en: You have until the end of today,
after which time I never want to see you set foot upon my land again.
translation.it: e non dovrai mettere più piede sulla mia proprietà.

translation.en: -Do I make myself clear? -Oh, perfectly.
I better get packing then.
Mrs. Flint. Mrs. Flint, excuse me.
-I have to get Josephine to bed. -I know you've heard things.
translation.it: - Metto a letto Josephine. - So delle voci.

translation.en: Please, I can't do this. We lease this farm from Sir Clifford.
translation.it: La prego, lasci stare. Questa fattoria è di Sir Clifford.

translation.en: And you always will.
You met him here, didn't you? The day he came to get milk?
translation.it: L'ha incontrato qui quando è venuto a prendere il latte?

translation.en: -I thought you'd come to see us. -Of course I did.
translation.it: - Credevo fosse qui per noi. - Certo.

translation.en: I found where you parked the car in the trees.
-No, that was one time. -I don't want to know.
translation.it: - È successo una volta. - Non voglio sapere.

translation.en: Good evening, Lady Chatterley.
[Connie] What are you doing? Where are you going?
The cat is well and truly out of the bag now, Connie.
Everybody's talking.
I've been sacked.
You cannot be seen here, Connie. You need to be in Venice.
translation.it: Non devono vederti qui. Devi andare a Venezia.

translation.en: -But we could just leave together. Now. -Look at me.
I have nothing to give you.
I've no job. I've no home. I've no purpose in life. Nothing.
translation.it: Non ho un lavoro, una casa, uno scopo nella vita. Nulla.

translation.en: Don't say that.
You are everything to me.
[man] Mellors!
You need to go!
-Look at me. -Shh.
Promise me, promise me we'll share our lives.
translation.it: Promettimi che condivideremo le nostre vite.

translation.en: -Aye. -Promise.
Aye, me lass.
When the time comes. When the time comes.
-[man] Mellors! -[Oliver] Oh…
Ayuh, can I grab me coat, mate, or…
translation.it: Ayuh, posso almeno prendere la giacca o…

translation.en: I'll find you.
Wherever you are, I'll find you.
-My Ladyship, you shouldn't be here. -No, Mrs. Bolton.
translation.it: - Sua signoria, non dovrebbe essere qui. - No, sig.ra Bolton.

translation.en: [Clifford] Connie.
It's all true.
Why would you do this?
-It was your idea. -My idea? No, no, no.
translation.it: - È stata una tua idea. - Mia? No.

translation.en: Clifford, you knew perfectly well what I was getting into.
With the right sort of man. I said the right sort!
Oliver Mellors is a better person than anyone I've ever met.
translation.it: Oliver Mellors è l'uomo migliore che abbia mai conosciuto.

translation.en: I was perfectly clear, Connie.
-We discussed the rules. -I'm going to have his child.
translation.it: - Conoscevi le regole. - Avrò un figlio da lui.

translation.en: You're going to--
You're sure?
But… everybody knows.
You can't possibly expect me to claim that child as mine now.
translation.it: Non puoi aspettarti che ora dica che è figlio mio.

translation.en: No, I…
I don't. I don't.
I want a divorce, Clifford.
I'm leaving you.
No. No, you can't.
Look, I'm… I'm so sorry about how this has all turned out,
translation.it: Ascolta, mi dispiace per come sono andate le cose,

translation.en: but we both know that this… marriage
translation.it: ma sappiamo entrambi che il nostro

translation.en: has been very unhappy for a very long time now.
translation.it: è un matrimonio infelice da tempo.

translation.en: It hasn't been. It hasn't been. Not for me.
translation.it: Per me non lo è stato.

translation.en: Well, yes.
Because you laid out all the rules.
translation.it: Perché hai deciso tu le regole.

translation.en: And I tried to follow them.
translation.it: E io ho cercato di rispettarle.

translation.en: I tried to support you in every way I could.
translation.it: Ho provato a sostenerti come potevo.

translation.en: [voice shaking] But you gave me nothing in return.
translation.it: Ma in cambio non mi hai dato nulla.

translation.en: Not the slightest drop of affection or kindness.
translation.it: Neanche un goccio di affetto o gentilezza.

translation.en: And what's worse, you made me feel ashamed for even wanting those things.
translation.it: E addirittura mi hai fatto vergognare di aver desiderato quelle cose.

translation.en: I've always cared for you, Connie.
translation.it: Io mi sono sempre preso cura di te.

translation.en: Yes, cared for me.
In the same way you care for your books and for your radio,
translation.it: Come ti prendi cura dei tuoi libri e della tua radio,

translation.en: but never in the ways I need you to.
translation.it: ma mai come avrei avuto bisogno.

translation.en: [Clifford] I love you, Connie.
I've loved you the only way I know how.
translation.it: Ti ho amata nel solo modo che conosco.

translation.en: I've given you everything I know how to give.
translation.it: Ti ho dato tutto ciò che sapevo dare.

translation.en: It's not enough.
Then talk to me, Con.
Help me understand.
Show me how I can prove to you how I feel.
translation.it: Dimmi come posso dimostrarti ciò che provo.

translation.en: Let me go.
Please.
Let me go.
Go.
Though know this.
I will never grant you your divorce.
translation.it: non ti concederò mai il divorzio.

translation.en: Because you broke your word.
Because you've made a mockery of my life here in Wragby.
translation.it: Hai gettato il ridicolo sulla mia vita qui a Wragby.

translation.en: I am not inclined to give you anything ever again.
translation.it: E non ti concederò mai nient'altro.

translation.en: I don't think you ever really were.
I wasn't meaning to pry, but I worried about you.
translation.it: Scusi l'intromissione, ma ero in pena per lei.

translation.en: I'm all right. [sighs]
Listen.
You have no idea where Mellors has gone? No.
translation.it: - Lei sa dov'è andato Mellors? - No.

translation.en: Would you ask your friends to let you know if they hear any news?
translation.it: Può chiedere alle sue amiche di avvertirla se ne avessero notizia?

translation.en: And why shall I say I'm asking?
Because I love him.
-Tell them that. -Yes, milady.
I do hope you find your gentleman.
translation.it: Spero che trovi il suo gentiluomo.

translation.en: Thank you, Mrs. Bolton.
So do I.
[woman 1] It's all true, then?
Has Her Ladyship left Sir Clifford?
translation.it: Sua signoria ha lasciato il marito?

translation.en: Her Ladyship has asked
that you will pass along any news of Mr. Mellors.
translation.it: di riferirle eventuali notizie sul sig. Mellors.

translation.en: "'Cause I love him," she said.
She gave up everything for him.
translation.it: Ha rinunciato a tutto per lui.

translation.en: Her title, her wealth, her position in the world.
Now she's lost him.
I'll not hear a word spoken against them.
translation.it: Non voglio sentir parlare male di loro.

translation.en: This is a love story.
This place is losing its charm, don't you think?
translation.it: Venezia sta perdendo il suo fascino, non credi?

translation.en: What?
Let's go back to London.
All right.
I'm Connie Reid. I don't think we met.
translation.it: Sono Connie Reid. Non ci conosciamo.

translation.en: Have a lovely evening.
How many times have you read that page?
translation.it: Quante volte hai letto quella pagina?

translation.en: What?
Well… it looks as though he's found you.
translation.it: Beh, a quanto pare ti ha trovata.

translation.en: -Oh my God. -Yes.
You'll want my car again, I imagine.
translation.it: Immagino che vorrai di nuovo l'auto.

translation.en: [Oliver] You'll be impressed to learn that word of your departure from Wragby
translation.it: È giunta notizia della tua partenza da Wragby

translation.en: has made it all the way to my little village in Scotland.
translation.it: fin nel mio piccolo villaggio scozzese.

translation.en: A man came to work in the local mines, brought the tale with him,
translation.it: Un uomo giunto qui per lavorare nelle miniere locali ha raccontato al pub

translation.en: telling everyone in the pub about a lady who fell for a hired man
translation.it: la storia dell'amore tra un domestico e una dama

translation.en: and didn't care if the world knew it because… she loved him.
translation.it: a cui non importava che si sapesse, perché lo amava.

translation.en: Names weren't used, of course.
I was simply "the gamekeeper."
You were the "Lady in love."
Excuse me, I'm looking for Oliver Mellors.
Do you… Do you know him? [man] Oh yes, I do.
He's down that road.
Thank you. Thank you so much!
[Oliver] It was a good story, and I found myself wondering
translation.it: Era una bella storia e mi sono chiesto

translation.en: if there might be more to the tale.
A feller I knew from the army got me work at a farm here.
translation.it: Un ex commilitone mi ha trovato lavoro in una fattoria.

translation.en: Thirty shillings a week and decent lodgings in a cottage up the road.
translation.it: 30 scellini a settimana e un alloggio decente in un cottage.

translation.en: I thought I needed a purpose
before bringing you and a child into my life.
translation.it: prima di accogliere te e un figlio.

translation.en: [Oliver] I can't say I've found any greater meaning here on the farm,
translation.it: Non posso dire di aver trovato uno scopo qui alla fattoria,

translation.en: but I've made a home.
I can't imagine what you've already been through and how much you've already given up.
translation.it: Non so immaginare cosa devi aver passato e a cosa hai già rinunciato.

translation.en: You'd be giving up even more to come live here with me,
translation.it: Rinunceresti ad altre cose ancora venendo a vivere qui con me, ma…

translation.en: [Oliver] …what we have… together
is different than anything I've ever known.
translation.it: è qualcosa che non ho mai vissuto prima.

translation.en: There's a little flame between us. It's always burning.
translation.it: C'è una fiammella tra noi. Brucia perennemente.

translation.en: And I've come to believe that tending a fire like that is…
translation.it: E ho capito che averne cura

translation.en: purpose enough for any life.
translation.it: è uno scopo sufficiente per chiunque.
